summary: Implemented a BTC donation details UI in the “Get Involved” → “Donate” section, including a configurable BTC address with copy-to-clipboard feedback, an expandable QR-code area, and a clear fallback message when no address is configured. However, the QR code generation appears to be a placeholder pattern rather than a properly scannable QR encoding of the BTC address, which may not meet the scannability acceptance criteria.

missing_requirements.requirement: When a BTC address is configured, the donation UI includes a scannable QR code representation of the BTC address (client-generated; no backend dependency).
missing_requirements.reason: The added QR generator explicitly states it is a placeholder and not a proper QR encoding implementation, so the produced image may not be scannable as a QR code for the BTC address.
evidence: frontend/src/lib/btcQr.ts (comments: "simple SVG placeholder" / "placeholder implementation" / "real QR codes require proper encoding")
